meta.title: Operation of Biosafety Cabinet Class II

sections.purpose: To provide personnel, product, and environmental protection during the handling of biohazardous materials.
sections.scope: Applicable to aseptic work and pathogen handling in Microbiology.
procedure: Turn ON the blower and light; wait 15-20 minutes for air stabilization.
Verify that the alarm is functional and airflow is normal.
Surface-disinfect the work area and all items being moved into the cabinet.
Position materials to separate 'clean' and 'contaminated' zones.
Keep movements slow and minimize the number of items in the workspace.
Ensure the sash is at the correct operating height.
Discard waste into a biohazard bag kept inside the cabinet.
Clean and disinfect all surfaces after finishing the tasks.
Run the blower for 10 minutes post-work before switching OFF.
Record the usage and UV lamp status in the log.
precautions: Never use the UV light while personnel are in the room.
Do not use open flames; use electric incinerators if sterilization is needed.
Keep the front grille clear of all objects.
Wear double gloves if working with high-risk agents.
Report any airflow failure alarms immediately.
